bibl.title: Living the High Life: Late Antique Archaeology in the Delta.
bibl.note: City, rural town, countryside: Settlement patterns and process [""Twin mound"", ""high, square"" and ""levee"" type sites; - Lagoon-shore and island sites; - ""Mutubis"" type site; - Site typology]. - Temple and church [Buto; - Athribis; - Sais; - Tell Qabrit (Kopret); - Other Late Antique buildings]. - Material culture. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork

bibl.seg: Penelope Wilson, Living the High Life: Late Antique Archaeology in the Delta.

Elisabeth R. O'Connell (ed.), Egypt in the First Millennium AD. Perspectives from New Fieldwork = British Museum Publications on Egypt and Sudan. 2 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 43-58, 1 tabl., 7 figg. et pll. 1-4.

City, rural town, countryside: Settlement patterns and process [""Twin mound"", ""high, square"" and ""levee"" type sites; - Lagoon-shore and island sites; - ""Mutubis"" type site; - Site typology]. - Temple and church [Buto; - Athribis; - Sais; - Tell Qabrit (Kopret); - Other Late Antique buildings]. - Material culture. - Conclusion.
